Immediate effects

As soon as you take a drag from a cigarette, there are changes in your body, including:

You may feel more relaxed, but your blood pressure and heart rate start to rise.

Your heart begins to pump differently, and the blood flow to the capillaries decreases.

Levels of a poisonous gas called carbon monoxide, increase in your bloodstream. This means less oxygen reaches the brain, muscles and other organs.

Tiny finger-like cilia which keep your airways clear of phlegm and debris are 'stunned' by chemicals in the smoke so don't do their job as well.

There are several documented benefits to smoking cigarettes. One of which, is that smokers tend to fare better than their non-smoking counterparts after suffering from a heart attack. In fact, according to Live Science, smokers have a lower mortality rate and respond better to two forms of treatment after a heart attack: fibrinolytic therapy and angioplasty.

Smoking cigarettes may actually decrease your chances of becoming obese. Although it is not uncommon that someone may be overweight while smoking, statistically, smoking does decrease the likelihood of becoming obese. In fact, in the 1920s, tobacco companies targeted women by offering “a great way to lose weight”.

According to the American Journal of Epidemiology, smoking may help to lessen the risk of Parkinson’s disease. It is noted that this occurrence has been observed over the last 30 years. It was noted in the early 2000s that caffeine may also hold the same protective properties.

Immediate effects

As soon as you take a drag from a cigarette, there are changes in your body, including:

You may feel more relaxed, but your blood pressure and heart rate start to rise.

Your heart begins to pump differently, and the blood flow to the capillaries decreases.

Levels of a poisonous gas called carbon monoxide, increase in your bloodstream. This means less oxygen reaches the brain, muscles and other organs.

Tiny finger-like cilia which keep your airways clear of phlegm and debris are 'stunned' by chemicals in the smoke so don't do their job as well.

There are several documented benefits to smoking cigarettes. One of which, is that smokers tend to fare better than their non-smoking counterparts after suffering from a heart attack. In fact, according to Live Science, smokers have a lower mortality rate and respond better to two forms of treatment after a heart attack: fibrinolytic therapy and angioplasty.

Smoking cigarettes may actually decrease your chances of becoming obese. Although it is not uncommon that someone may be overweight while smoking, statistically, smoking does decrease the likelihood of becoming obese. In fact, in the 1920s, tobacco companies targeted women by offering “a great way to lose weight”.

According to the American Journal of Epidemiology, smoking may help to lessen the risk of Parkinson’s disease. It is noted that this occurrence has been observed over the last 30 years. It was noted in the early 2000s that caffeine may also hold the same protective properties.

牛油果減肥】靚脂肪一樣食肥人　營養師：牛油果是一塊油
撰文：梁苡珊
2017-03-17 20:00
最後更新日期：2017-04-26 11:35
近年行入餐廳，每每都會見到牛油果的身影，沙律、三文治甚至壽司它都摻一腳。牛油果的健康形象突出，有說可效抗衰老，更被追捧為減肥神物，不過又有指它的植物脂肪含量豐富，吃牛油果減肥只會越食越肥，真正能有效減肥的是牛油果籽。好迷惘......想減肥，究竟選肉定核？資深營養師潘慧德（Janice）來解構。

牛油果被追捧為健康蔬果，可抗老又可減肥，真唔真？（iStock）
牛油果被追捧為健康蔬果，可抗老又可減肥，真唔真？（iStock）

進食牛油果真的可以減肥？
Janice指市面上普通大小的牛油果一個約有320kcal，果肉只含少量的糖分、澱粉質，其餘都是脂肪。是的，其餘都是脂肪。「嚴格而言牛油果是一塊油，一個普通的牛油果大約等於5茶匙的油。」

雖然牛油果會為我們帶來飽肚感，降低食慾，但它算是高卡路里及高脂肪的食物，無節制地進食一樣致肥。Janice指一個普通的大小的牛油果有約29克的脂肪，是世界衛生組織建議每日應吸收脂肪的8成。「如果一日吃一個牛油果的話，其他的飲食幾乎要零油份才可以keep fit。」

Janice又提醒，減肥是多方面的事，不應只單靠一種食物，還要配合運動及其他飲食等。

【牛油果好處背後】牛油果營養豐富　你是否適宜進食要搞清
牛油果的脂肪不是「靚脂肪」嗎？
「靚脂肪只是形容其質量，再美的脂肪也是脂肪，不代表可以吃得多，應適可而止。」Janice指牛油果29克總脂肪中，有20克是單元不包和脂肪酸，也是坊間所指「靚脂肪」，這種脂肪酸更是牛油果獨有。不過脂肪都是脂肪，不會lesser evil，減肥中的各位要多加留意。

那每天吃半個牛油果算多嗎？
在最理想的低脂飲食中，每人每日應進食兩湯匙油分，而半個牛油果大約有15克脂肪，接近一湯匙油。「如果以香港人的飲食習慣，三餐總有一餐在外吃，或是與家人同台食飯的話，九成都是油多，可能就要小心。」
